title: Improved Partial Differential Equation and Fast Approximation Algorithm for Hazy/Underwater/Dust Storm Image Enhancement
author: Uche A. Nnolim (Department of Electronic Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, University of Nigeria, Nsukka, Enugu, Nigeria)
relevance_why: The paper introduces a de-hazing algorithm that could improve image clarity, which may benefit visual aspects of audio-visual projects.
background: Enhancing the visibility of outdoor images affected by haze, dust, or underwater conditions to make them clearer for analysis and interpretation.
contribution: This paper introduces a modified partial differential equation (PDE)-based algorithm to solve issues in image enhancement from hazy images, achieving better visibility without darkening or over-enhancing edges.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods like the guided filter and dark channel prior led to darkened images and noise enhancement.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves upon them by using a log-less operator in the PDE framework, reducing artifacts while maintaining image quality.

key_innovation: Combining logarithmic image processing models with PDE formulations to refine image visibility without typical drawbacks like halo effects.
real_world_impact: The algorithm’s improvement in de-hazing could enhance surveillance and navigation systems in poor visibility conditions, aiding in safety and efficiency.
limitations: Some images still exhibit darkening or over-enhancement despite improvements.

new_terms.partial differential equation (PDE): **Partial differential equation (PDE)** refers to a mathematical equation involving functions and their partial derivatives, used in this paper to model image processing tasks.
new_terms.contrast limited adaptive histogram equa: **CLAHE** is a contrast enhancement technique that improves the contrast of an image by limiting the amplification of noise, effective in local regions.
